lexUnit.name: calm.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become tranquil and quiet.

sentence.text: She calms her shattered nerves with the music of top Co Donegal-born singing star Enya .
The relentless throb of the pop music soothed David and calmed the panic that seized his heart .
Michael Stein was trying unsuccessfully to calm an irate customer who was arguing about his bill .
It enveloped Sylvie , chilled the dampness of her forehead , calmed the fever which had brought her here .
Corbett stopped , calming his horse which grew skittish at the sight .
In addition , a couple of deep breaths calms the nerves wonderfully when your adrenalin is flowing .
Willie tried to calm Sammy who was jumping about excitedly .
When the Countess tried to calm her , explaining the picture had been sent off to be cleaned , Diana refused to believe her .
She calmed him , and he dropped off .
I did n't panic like Mum did and I think I calmed him .
Li Shai Tung took a long breath , calming himself .
Her look calmed me .
` Small things like music , plants and magazines in the waiting rooms help to calm nerves .
The addictive agent is nicotine , which calms the nerves , relaxes the muscles and attenuates the appetite .
What investors in drug firms really need is a pill to calm their nerves .
As we tried to calm ourselves with sweet coffee , a Swiss traveller appeared .
Officials hope that an early announcement might calm the soldiers .
This theory would explain why many quite aggressive dogs are calmed by the treatment .
I really had thought she would go berserk , but she just trembled from head to toe , and was only calmed slightly by the sound of my voice .
One pupil told her grandmother , who was so shocked she had to be calmed down by her son and daughter-in-law .
Athelstan let his mind and soul be calmed , moved by the rhythmical chanting .
It was at this critical moment that good sense got the better of the others , Big Pat was calmed down and a semblance of order was restored .
After his return to England , he explained to Dorothy Pound that her husband needed somehow to be calmed down .
He was eventually calmed down when a doorman sat on him .
This seemed to worry the two men , and they took several minutes to calm Bobbie down and to stop her crying .
You ca n't understand why they do n't calm her down
When he 'd gone , she leaned back and tried to calm herself down .
Nobody was in any danger from the horse but the plaintiff entered the field and tried to calm the horse and was injured .
In the end it was Mary who had to calm Martin down , reassure him and promise to come back the next day .
Mrs. Farr , hearing my screams , came out , picked me up , carried me into the house , calmed me down , then applied some first aid .
